children.value: We've gone through the basic of SchemaHero by deploying a database, creating a schema and then editing the schema. SchemaHero can do a lot more, including run simple migrations, manage tables and migrations that depend on each other and more.
This tutorial should continue to expand with more use cases. For now, try experimenting with it, and open an issue on
if run into problems or have questions!

pages.title: Declarative Schema Management
pages.description: An explanation of the declarative schema management concept

pages.title: Introduction
pages.description: Start here to understand the SchemaHero tutorial

pages.title: Install SchemaHero
pages.description: Learn how to install the SchemaHero kubectl plugin and the in-cluster Operator

pages.title: Connect A Database
pages.description: Learn how to configure SchemaHero to manage a database

pages.title: Create A New Table
pages.description: Learn how to create a new table using SchemaHero

pages.title: Sequential Migrations
pages.description: Comparing SchemaHero's declarative model to sequence migrations

pages.title: ORM
pages.description: Comparing SchemaHero to an ORM (Object Relational Mapper)
